hypothesis_content.title: Social Media Sentiment Divergence Alpha
hypothesis_content.statement: When social media sentiment (weighted BTC+ETH mentions) reaches extreme bearish levels (<0.2 on -1 to +1 scale) while exchange netflows turn positive (more inflows than outflows) and realized volatility is below 30-day average, contrarian long positions generate alpha within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Retail sentiment extremes often mark local bottoms when contradicted by smart money flows (exchange netflows). Low volatility during bearish sentiment suggests lack of panic selling, creating setup for quick reversion.
entry_conditions: No major negative news events in prior 24h

exit_conditions.take_profit: Sentiment score rebounds to >0.4 OR 6% price appreciation
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Sentiment drops below 0.1 with price breaking below 20-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Negative sentiment persists alongside continued outflows and increasing volatility, indicating genuine distribution rather than sentiment washout.
